thread.title: You Should Totally Take Your Kids To Vegas And Here's Why
thread.title_full: You Should Totally Take Your Kids To Vegas And Here's Why

author: Krista Torres
title: You Should Totally Take Your Kids To Vegas And Here's Why
text:
View this image ›
Jenny Chang / Via BuzzFeed ID: 10609157 1. You can take your kids to Marvel Avenger S.T.A.T.I.O.N. inside Treasure Island. View this image ›
21st_ld / Via instagram.com Marvel’s Avengers S.T.A.T.I.O.N. (Scientific Training and Tactical Intelligence Operative Network) is an interactive and educational experience for parents and children. You get to play with props, learn the science behind the Marvel characters, and see them on display.
ID: 10546072 2. Go on a Scoot City tour of Las Vegas where you’ll stop at some memorable landmarks. View this image ›
vikkinw / Via instagram.com Cruise through the Las Vegas strip and downtown Las Vegas in style! You get conveniently picked up and dropped off right at your hotel.
ID: 10554180 3. The High Roller Observation Wheel at The Linq will be something everyone will enjoy. View this image ›
ashleyparrett / Via instagram.com Measuring 520 feet in diameter, this wheel takes thirty minutes to complete one revolution and gives you a great view of the entire strip.
ID: 10546317 4. Make a splash with the fam at Wet ‘N’ Wild Las Vegas . View this image ›
angela__may / Via instagram.com This water park features more than 25 slides and attractions, covering more than 20 acres. It’s only a 20-minute drive from the Strip.
ID: 10540164 5. Get your chocolate fix at Hershey’s Chocolate World in New York, New York. View this image ›
picsbyconnie / Via instagram.com The two-story store features over 800 Hershey’s candies. There are fun sculptures to pose by and souvenirs to take home.
ID: 10540166 6. Get even more sweets at M & M’s World next to the MGM Grand. Bernard Spragg / Via Flickr
Sean MacEntee / Via Flickr
 M & M’s World features four floors of chocolate heaven. Need I say more?
ID: 10554254 7. The Tree House and Play Zone at Container Park on Fremont street offers fun, shopping, and dining. View this image ›
the_reyzer / Via instagram.com The tree house includes a 33-foot-tall slide, a NEOS play system, and lots of other fun stuff to do!
ID: 10540170 8. Take a trip to the World Famous Toy Shack on Fremont Street. View this image ›
ridgetop21 / Via instagram.com The Toy Shack buys and sells vintage toys, specifically iconic brands of the 1980s.
ID: 10540171 9. Admire the Fountains of Bellagio . View this image ›
art_mceachern / Via instagram.com The water dances along with music and lights in a beautifully choreographed show. It’s also free, which is a plus!
ID: 10540173 10. Explore the Shark Reef Aquarium at Mandalay Bay. View this image ›
gvelez14 / Via instagram.com The Shark Reef Aquarium is a total sensory experience under the sea with fantastic sights, sounds, and encounters.
ID: 10540176 11. Experience the Eiffel Tower at Paris Hotel. View this image ›
sian_louise21 / Via instagram.com This attraction is a half scale replica of the world-famous Paris, France landmark. You travel 46 stories up to the observation deck where you can get a 360 view of the city.
ID: 10540178 12. The Adventuredome at Circus Circus will keep you entertained for hours. m4xfly / Via instagram.com
kaitlyngboyd / Via instagram.com
 This indoor theme park features bumper cars, an arcade, and a huge roller coaster that travels at 55 mph.
ID: 10570864 13. Book a guided tour of the Neon Boneyard Museum . View this image ›
voccabird2 / Via instagram.com Check out the fabulously unique neon signs from ages ago at this museum. It’s about a ten-minute drive from the Las Vegas strip.
ID: 10540182 14. Learn about the past at the Natural History Museum. View this image ›
Flickr: kennejima / Via Creative Commons Located just five miles off the Strip, this museum features life-size dinosaur sculptures, sea creatures, and much more.
ID: 10540187 15. The Gondola Rides at the Venetian will make you feel like you’re actually in Venice. View this image ›
Flickr: jimg944 / Via Creative Commons On your ride, you will float beneath bridges, beside cafes, under balconies and through the vibrant Venetian streetscape inside the Venetian hotel.
ID: 10563445 16. Time travel back to the medieval times during the Tournament of Kings at the Excalibur hotel. View this image ›
twtyblu / Via instagram.com This live-action dinner show takes place in a 900-seat theater arena and features jousting, sword fights, and more!
ID: 10570768 17. Get your thrill on at the Big Apple Coaster in New York, New York. View this image ›
newyorknewyork.com The bigger kids will love this adventure-seeking thrill ride. It features a 180-degree “heartline” twist and dive maneuver.
ID: 10540192 18. The Fall of Atlantis show at Caesar’s Palace will leave you in awe. View this image ›
vegasvipbottles.com Enjoy this free show outside the forum shops, featuring special animatronic statues. Shows happens every hour on the hour.
ID: 10570875 Check out more articles on BuzzFeed.com!
